workflow.name: Automated sales follow-up system using HighLevel, Gmail, Slack & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## üìò Description:
This workflow automates sales contact follow-ups and engagement tracking by integrating HighLevel CRM, Gmail, Slack, and Google Sheets. It fetches all contacts from HighLevel, filters inactive contacts, sends personalized follow-up emails, checks for responses, and notifies the sales team accordingly.
 It eliminates manual follow-up tracking, ensures timely outreach, and provides real-time notifications ‚Äî helping sales teams maintain engagement, respond promptly, and improve lead conversion.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ Manual Trigger ‚Äì Starts the automation manually
Action: Initiates the workflow for immediate follow-up execution or testing.

üì¶ Fetch Contacts from HighLevel CRM
Action: Retrieves all contacts from HighLevel, including names, emails, and metadata for full visibility.

üîç Validate Deal Fetch Success (IF Node)
Action: Verifies that fetched contacts contain valid IDs.

 ‚úÖ True Path: Continues to filter inactive contacts.

 ‚ùå False Path: Logs invalid or missing contacts to Google Sheets for auditing and troubleshooting.

üßπ Filter Contacts with No Response
Action: Selects contacts who have not replied in the last 24 hours, ensuring follow-ups target only inactive leads.

üìä Get Most Recent Contact
Action: Retrieves the latest contact based on last updated time and calculates hours since last interaction.

üìß Send Follow-Up Email to Contact
Action: Sends a personalized email to the contact, asking for confirmation or questions and including dynamic details like name and last interaction time.

‚è≥ Wait for 24 Hours Before Next Action
Action: Pauses the workflow for 24 hours to allow contacts sufficient time to respond.

üì® Retrieve Email Thread for Response
Action: Fetches the most recent Gmail thread using the thread ID to check if the contact has replied.

‚úÖ Check If Contact Responded with ‚ÄúYes‚Äù (IF Node)
Action: Evaluates if the response contains the word ‚Äúyes‚Äù.

 ‚úÖ True Path: Triggers Slack notification for positive response.

 ‚ùå False Path: Triggers Slack notification for no response.

üí¨ Notify Sales Team in Slack if Response Received
Action: Sends a Slack message notifying the team of a positive reply, including contact details and response snippet.

‚ö†Ô∏è Notify Sales Team in Slack if No Response
Action: Sends a Slack message notifying the team that the contact hasn‚Äôt replied, including contact info, follow-up timestamp, and waiting status.

üö® Log Fetch or Validation Errors (Error Handling)
Action: Records any fetch or validation errors in Google Sheets for easy review and troubleshooting.

## üß© Prerequisites
HighLevel CRM API OAuth credentials
Gmail OAuth2 credentials for sending and fetching emails
Google Sheets document for error logging
Slack API credentials for notifications

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Fully automated follow-up workflow for sales contacts
 ‚úÖ Timely notifications for positive and inactive responses
 ‚úÖ Personalized emails to contacts
 ‚úÖ Transparent tracking and logging of errors
 ‚úÖ Seamless integration across HighLevel, Gmail, Slack, and Google Sheets

## üë• Perfect For
Sales teams managing multiple leads
Marketing teams ensuring lead engagement
Startups scaling outreach efforts
Organizations using HighLevel CRM + Gmail + Slack for sales follow-ups

parameters.content:
## Node Name: Fetch Contacts from HighLevel
**Action**: Retrieves all contacts from the HighLevel CRM.
**Description**:
This node connects to the HighLevel API using OAuth credentials and fetches all contacts. It pulls data such as contact names, email addresses, and other related metadata to be processed in subsequent steps.

## Node Name: Validate Deal Fetch Success
**Action**: Validates if the deal fetch was successful or not.
**Description**:
This node checks whether the fetched data (deal or contact) exists. If the data is invalid or missing, it logs an error or redirects to error handling.

## Node Name: Log Errors in Google Sheets
**Action**: Logs any errors encountered during data fetching or validation.
**Description**:
This node logs any errors or issues that occur during the fetching or validation steps into a Google Sheet for auditing and future reference. It ensures that all issues are recorded for troubleshooting.

## Node Name: Filter Contacts with No Response
**Action**: Filters contacts who have not responded in the last 24 hours.
**Description**:
This node processes the input contacts and filters out those who have not replied to recent communications within the last 24 hours. It calculates the time difference and selects only contacts who have been inactive for a specified period.

## Node Name: Get Most Recent Contact
**Action**: Retrieves the most recent contact based on the last updated date.
**Description**:
This node sorts the contacts by their most recent update and selects the one with the latest activity. It also calculates the number of hours since the last update and formats it for easy communication.

## Node Name: Send Follow-Up Email to Contact
**Action**: Sends a follow-up email to a contact.
**Description**:
This node sends a personalized follow-up email to the selected contact. The email asks for confirmation and offers help in case the contact has any further questions or concerns.

## Node Name: Wait for 24 Hours Before Next Action
**Action**: Pauses the workflow for 24 hours before continuing.
**Description**:
This node introduces a 24-hour delay in the workflow. It is typically used when waiting for a response or allowing some time before the next step in the automation process is triggered.

## Node Name: Retrieve Email Thread for Response
**Action**: Fetches the email thread based on the provided thread ID.
**Description**:
This node retrieves the most recent email thread from Gmail using the thread ID. It's used for checking if the contact has responded and fetching the necessary email data for processing.

## Node Name: Check If Contact Responded with 'Yes'
**Action**: Evaluates if the email response contains the word "yes".
**Description**:
This node checks the email response content for the keyword "yes". If found, it signals that the contact has replied positively, triggering the appropriate follow-up action.

## Node Name: Notify Sales Team in Slack if No Response
**Action**: Sends a notification to Slack if no response has been received from the contact.
**Description**:
If no response has been received from the contact, this node notifies the sales team via Slack. It includes relevant details such as the contact's email and follow-up status, so the team can take the next steps.

## Node Name: Notify Sales Team in Slack if Response Received
**Action**: Sends a notification to Slack if a response is received from the contact.
**Description**:
If the contact responds positively (i.e., the email contains "yes"), this node notifies the sales team in Slack, highlighting the response and providing further details for the next action.

parameters.message:
=

Hi {{ $json.firstName || $json.contactName }},

I hope this email finds you well!

I wanted to follow up with you as I noticed we haven't heard back from you in the last {{ $json.hoursAgo }} hours (since {{ $json.dateUpdated }}).

Just checking in to see if you had any questions or if there's anything I can help you with?

Looking forward to hearing from you! Replay to " yes " to confirm your Availability

Best regards,
Your Team
parameters.subject: =Just Checking In - {{ $json.contactName }}

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
